{"step_by_step_thinking": "The hypothalamus controls the release of hormones from the pituitary gland, including both prolactin and growth hormone. It does this through releasing and inhibitory hormones. For prolactin, the hypothalamus releases dopamine, which inhibits the release of prolactin. For growth hormone, the hypothalamus releases growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH) to stimulate its release, and somatostatin to inhibit its release.", "answer_choice": "D. Both Prolactin and Growth hormone"}
